title: How To Get Your Kids To Eat More Vegetables
summary: You don’t have to give up on veggies completely if your child doesn't like them. Some veggies are just easier for kids to accept than others. You can't expect your child to go from eating nothing but pizza to eating a salad with croutons every night. It’s important to start with baby steps and work your way up. Hiding vegetables in other foods is a great way to get your kids to eat more vegetables in their diet. Don't forget dessert. Dark chocolate has lots of antioxidants and will help boost your child's immune system.

You don\u2019t have to give up on veggies completely if your child doesn\u2019t like them \u2013 but you shouldn\u2019t push it either.`),mdx("p",null,"Some veggies are just easier for kids to accept than others. Even though all veggies are nutritious, some are more nutritious than others."),mdx("p",null,"Broccoli and cauliflower are good examples of this. They\u2019re both healthy \u2013 but broccoli is even better for you."),mdx("p",null,"But broccoli is also a bit of a pain to eat for a small child. It\u2019s not easy to chew, and it\u2019s even harder to swallow. Cauliflower, on the other hand, is much easier to eat. It\u2019s softer and has a much milder flavour."),mdx("h2",null,"Start With Baby Steps"),mdx("p",null,"You can\u2019t expect your child to go from eating nothing but pizza to eating a salad with croutons every night. You\u2019ll just end up frustrated and they\u2019ll end up hungry."),mdx("p",null,"It\u2019s important to start with baby steps and work your way up. You might want to start with smoothies or fruit snacks that combine some veggies with some fruit. That way, the kids get a bit of everything they need in one go."),mdx("p",null,"You can also try hiding vegetables in other foods. It might sound sneaky, but it\u2019s a great way to get your kids to start including more vegetables in their diet."),mdx("p",null,"If you have them on your side, you\u2019ll have made a great start to getting them eating better. Once they\u2019ve got used to eating veggies, they\u2019ll be able to start weeding out the ones they don\u2019t like. At that point, you can encourage them to try new things."),mdx("h2",null,"Sneak It In"),mdx("p",null,`As we\u2019ve said, you shouldn\u2019t try to sneak all the veggies into everything, but it can be a good way to start.
While you can\u2019t just put broccoli in everything, you can add spices and herbs which have a similar effect.`),mdx("p",null,"Cinnamon, for example, is great for regulating blood sugar levels. It\u2019s also a fantastic antioxidant. If you add cinnamon to your kid\u2019s food, they won\u2019t even know that they\u2019re eating something good for them."),mdx("p",null,"If you want to add a vegetable to something and make it barely noticeable, try adding spinach or avocado. They\u2019re both very mild and will barely change the flavour of the food you\u2019re adding them to."),mdx("h2",null,"Don't Forget Dessert"),mdx("p",null,`If your kid doesn\u2019t like vegetables, they\u2019re probably not getting a lot of the vitamins and minerals they need.
If they\u2019re sick often, or are just feeling really tired at the end of the day, there\u2019s a chance they\u2019re vitamin deficient. If you don\u2019t do something about it, it could lead to bigger problems down the road.
If you\u2019re having trouble getting your kid to eat vegetables, don\u2019t forget dessert.
Dark chocolate has lots of antioxidants and will help boost your child\u2019s immune system if you add it to their daily diet.
Blueberries are another great choice. They\u2019re packed with vitamins and are a delicious dessert that\u2019s easy to sneak into just about anything.`),mdx("h2",null,"Try New Foods Together"),mdx("p",null,`If you\u2019re trying to get your kids to eat more veggies, you need to try new things.
It\u2019s easy to fall into a rut with dinner and keep eating the same things over and over again. If you do that with veggies, your child is going to get bored and stop eating them. If you want them to keep eating their greens, you need to try a few new things.
Start with something simple and move up from there.
If your child has never eaten a pumpkin before, you don\u2019t want to try baking a pie, but you can make a simple pumpkin soup or stew. They\u2019ll get used to the taste and feel adventurous at the same time.`),mdx("h2",null,"Take A Break"),mdx("p",null,`Kids can be fickle, and they often go through phases where they just don\u2019t want to eat.
If your child just isn\u2019t interested in eating vegetables, there\u2019s no point in forcing them.
If you force them, they\u2019ll just push them away and resent you for it.
Instead, take a break and try again later.
Sometimes kids just need to take a break from eating vegetables until they\u2019re ready to come back to them again.
If you keep trying to get your kid to eat veggies, it\u2019ll only push them away until they\u2019re completely done with eating anything that isn\u2019t pizza.
Give them time and you might find that they\u2019re ready to try vegetables again.`),mdx("h2",null,"Summing Up"),mdx("p",null,`Kids are fickle and they don\u2019t always want to eat what\u2019s good for them. If you want them to start getting more vegetables in their diet, though, you need to start working on it early and be patient.
If you\u2019re patient, your child will learn to love vegetables and will be grateful for you later on. If they don\u2019t start eating more vegetables when they\u2019re little, though, they might end up having some health issues later on in life.
If your child isn\u2019t eating vegetables, don\u2019t worry. You can help them start eating more vegetables in no time by trying different things. Just be patient and keep trying and your child will be eating their greens in no time.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

Do you load up on fruits and vegetables every day? Do you take vitamins as part of your daily routine? Do you check nutrition labels to make sure your food is healthy? If you answered yes to all these questions, then why do you feel like you\u2019re not getting enough vitamins and minerals in your diet? There\u2019s nothing more frustrating than feeling like our eating habits aren\u2019t doing us any good. And unless you\u2019re eating an extremely restrictive diet, it can be disheartening to know that most of us don\u2019t get the recommended amount of vitamins and minerals from our diets.
What are vitamins and minerals? They are nutrients that our bodies need in small amounts for everyday processes. While deficiency can lead to some serious problems, getting too much of certain nutrients is also unhealthy. Here is everything you need to know about vitamins and minerals:`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

In fact, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) recommends adults get at least 150 minutes of moderate-intensity aerobic activity a week.
Working out can be a great way to relieve stress, increase your energy, and even improve your mental well-being. Don\u2019t let a hectic schedule or fear of getting started stop you from exercising. There are many ways to maximize your exercise routine to make the most out of every workout session. If you want to see an improvement in how fast you can run, how many pushups you can do, or how many times you can climb stairs without getting winded, read on for some great tips on how to make that happen!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

Do you often place the needs of others before your own? If so, you\u2019re definitely an amazing person. However, when it comes to your social life and personal interests, do those aspects take a backseat most of the time? Whether you come from a hectic work schedule or have other obligations that require your attention most of the time, being busy all the time can completely suck the life out of you.
If that sounds like you, don\u2019t worry! You aren\u2019t alone. Many people today find it difficult to carve out some time for themselves. Thankfully, it is possible to balance a busy schedule and make time for yourself. Here are some helpful suggestions on how you can make time for yourself even when you feel like there isn\u2019t any left in the world.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Make Healthy Eating Easier with Leftovers

Or perhaps you\u2019re just exhausted by how much effort it seems to take to eat healthy. While eating well isn\u2019t as simple as following a diet \u2014 there are so many different factors that go into it, and we all have our own personal preferences when it comes to what makes a meal healthy. But, there are ways to make eating well a piece of cake. Leftovers are one of those ways!
A meal made from scratch is an excellent way to ensure that you\u2019re staying on track with your New Year\u2019s resolutions. However, cooking every night is not realistic for most people. That doesn\u2019t mean you can\u2019t enjoy home-cooked meals without going through all the stressors of making them yourself \u2013 leftover cooking is your solution!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

The Benefits of a Healthy Diet - And How to Stick to It

intro.compiledSource:

It\u2019s also one of the most difficult to maintain. With all the tempting fast food, vending machine snacks, and restaurants with cheap but high-calorie meals, it\u2019s not easy to eat right. Luckily, there are plenty of ways to make sticking to a healthy diet easier.
If you want to improve your health, increase your energy, and lose weight\u2014while still enjoying great food\u2014a healthy diet is the way to do it. A healthy diet can help prevent disease and keep you feeling great. Following these tips can get you well on your way towards meeting your nutrition goals and eating a balanced diet that will keep you happy and healthy for life.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

How to Get Moving When You Don't Have Time for the Gym

intro.compiledSource:
var g=Object.defineProperty,d=Object.defineProperties;var m=Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptors;var n=Object.getOwnPropertySymbols;var r=Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty,s=Object.prototype.propertyIsEnumerable;var u=(e,t,o)=>t in e?g(e,t,{enumerable:!0,configurable:!0,writable:!0,value:o}):e[t]=o,i=(e,t)=>{for(var o in t||(t={}))r.call(t,o)&&u(e,o,t[o]);if(n)for(var o of n(t))s.call(t,o)&&u(e,o,t[o]);return e},y=(e,t)=>d(e,m(t));var h=(e,t)=>{var o={};for(var a in e)r.call(e,a)&&t.indexOf(a)<0&&(o[a]=e[a]);if(e!=null&&n)for(var a of n(e))t.indexOf(a)<0&&s.call(e,a)&&(o[a]=e[a]);return o};const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent(o){var a=o,{components:e}=a,t=h(a,["components"]);return mdx(MDXLayout,y(i(i({},layoutProps),t),{components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"}),mdx("p",null,`New Year, same old resolutions. If you\u2019re anything like the majority of people, chances are that you have made the same resolution to get fitter, healthier and happier this year as you did last year. But with a packed work schedule, social calendar and everything else going on in your life it can be difficult to find time to hit the gym or take up that new Zumba class you signed up for last October but never went to again.
And yet so many of us do manage to get moving. Yes, it might involve setting your alarm an hour earlier than usual, waking up on Saturday morning instead of Friday night and putting in some serious dedication \u2014 but it is possible. So if you\u2019re struggling to find time for the gym here are some creative ways how you can get moving when you don\u2019t have time for the gym:`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
